wiki.content:
"Inglorious" is the final song on the album Bastard. In this song, Tyler talks further in detail about how his father has left him and his mother and how it's affected him. But, Tyler is getting along quite well anyway, and just wants his father to know that he didn't even need him. Tyler seeks to unite all "Bastards" in this song with a hook that goes for the heart of an abandoning father. He ends the song pretending to kill himself yelling "Bang" which segues into "Goblin" the title track from the aforementioned next album.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Inglorious" is the final song on the album Bastard. In this song, Tyler talks further in detail about how his father has left him and his mother and how it's affected him. Tyler seeks to unite all "Bastards" in this song with a hook that goes for the heart of an abandoning father. He ends the song pretending to kill himself yelling "Bang" which segues into "Goblin" the title track from the aforementioned next album.

track.name: Inglorious
comments: who the fuck tagged this as braggadocio?
This is when I really realised how talented this guy is
I always thought he referred to the term 'Inglorious Bastards' with the outro and intro.
shit is dope. like his verse at the end of "oldie." some real shit
notice how on bastard how can be depressed but not come off as a complete bitch.
I really wish Tyler would write more songs like thing. He's really fantastic when he's being serious and heartfelt [5] best song on bastard imo
